a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Child mortality vs. prevalence of stunting, 2020
Child mortality is the share of newborns who die before reaching the age of five. Prevalence of stunting is the percentage of children under
age 5 whose height for age is more than two standard deviations below the median for the international reference population ages 0-59
Prevalence of stunting, height for age (% of children under 5)
Data source: Data compiled from multiple sources by World Bank
